requirements.summary: Fix the application logo so that it updates and displays correctly in both the HTML entry point and any React components that render the logo
acceptanceCriteria: The logo is visible and displays the correct, up-to-date image in the browser.
No broken image icon or stale cached logo appears on page load or refresh.
The logo asset path in index.html (favicon) and any logo rendered in the UI matches the intended image file.
The logo updates consistently across hard refresh and normal navigation.

file_operations.description: Update the favicon link href to point to the correct logo asset path. Ensure the path matches the actual logo file location in the project. Add cache-busting query parameter or update the asset reference to force browsers to reload the favicon.

Review and update any logo image references in the root component. If the logo is rendered in the UI (e.g., as an img element or background image), ensure the src or CSS reference points to the correct asset path and includes proper cache-busting mechanism if needed.

Check if this component or any other header/navigation components render the application logo. If found, update the logo asset reference to match the correct file path and ensure it displays the current logo image.
